resources.string: Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare
You will need a key code to report your infection. You will receive a key code from a healthcare professional or via text message from the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare.

Enter the key code on the phone you usually carry with you. Koronavilkku indicates potential exposure to users who have been close to you during the period when you could have infected others. The key code does not reveal your identity.
Exposure notifications must be turned on to report an infection. Enable exposure notifications in the Koronavilkku Home view.
You have already reported your infection
The information you have reported will help to tackle the coronavirus epidemic. The app is now locked and no longer collects information about nearby phones. We wish you a quick recovery!
The key code is invalid or has expired. Please check that you have entered the exact code you received.
Failed to report infection because the server cannot be reached. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Exposure notifications must be turned on to report an infection. Enable exposure notifications in the Koronavilkku Home view.
The key code does not reveal your identity.
The information you have reported will help to tackle the coronavirus epidemic. The app is now locked and no longer collects information about nearby phones. We wish you a quick recovery!
Checking for potential exposures has not been carried out for over 24 hours. The app will try again later. You can start a check now.
You may have been exposed to the coronavirus
You have not been near a person who has reported an infection
If you receive an exposure notification follow these instructions
Do you think you may have COVID-19?
How to protect yourself from an infection
Take an online medical COVID-19 symptom check-up
The app works even if you close it.
Thank you for reporting your infection. The app will no longer collect information about encounters. We wish you a quick recovery!

If you suspect that you have COVID-19, take an online COVID-19 symptom assessment in the Omaolo service. You will receive additional instructions based on your answers. It takes approximately 10 minutes to complete the assessment.
Take a symptom assessment in the Omaolo service
In the past 14 days, you have been close to a person who has reported a COVID-19 infection.
Contact healthcare services even if you do not have any symptoms consistent with COVID-19. Healthcare services will give you instructions and evaluate your need for a coronavirus test.
Koronavilkku has not detected exposures to the coronavirus in the last 14 days.
However, the application is not able to identify every situation where exposure may occur.
Follow the instructions below for 14 days. Continue to follow the instructions even if you receive a negative coronavirus test result.

Monitor your health. If you develop any symptom consistent with COVID-19, get tested for the coronavirus even if you have already been tested. Symptoms consistent with COVID-19 are change in sense of smell or taste, shortness of breath, cough, sore throat, runny nose, fever, headaches, muscle pain, unexplained diarrhoea or abdominal pain.
Avoid public places and public transport. If you have to visit public places, keep at least a two-meter distance to other people. Also use a face mask.
If possible, let someone else handle food shopping and other errands outside the home.

If you cough or sneeze, use a disposable tissue to cover your mouth and nose. Put the used tissue in a waste bin and wash your hands with water and soap or use hand sanitiser. If you do not have a tissue, cough or sneeze into your sleeve.
If you are not in Finland, follow any instructions given by local authorities.
The assessment of your exposure is based on encounters that Koronavilkku has collected during the last 14 days. The intensity of exposure cannot be accurately assessed.

Koronavilkku is an application produced by the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare that informs you if it estimates that you may have been exposed to the coronavirus. If you are diagnosed with COVID-19, you can report this anonymously using the app. Your privacy is strongly protected.
Each phone receives a random code
The application generates an ID code for each phone. The code is random and changes several times an hour to ensure your privacy. The ID code does not contain information about you or your phone.
Phones swap codes with each other
When close enough to each other, the apps swap codes through a Bluetooth signal. This allows the application to keep track of encounters without saving users\' identity or location data.
If you are diagnosed with COVID-19

If you are diagnosed with COVID-19, you will receive a key code from your healthcare professional. You can use this code to report your infection through the app. If you report your infection, the app sends your phone\'s ID codes to the server. No personal or location information is sent with the ID codes, so you will remain anonymous.

Koronavilkku downloads a list of codes from the server several times a day. The list contains the codes of the phones that have been used to report a COVID-19 infection through the app. Koronavilkku compares these codes to the codes your phone has collected from other app users. This enables the app to determine whether you have been near an infected person.
You receive a notification of potential exposure

If the codes collected by your phone match those received from people who have reported a COVID-19 infection, you will be notified of a potential exposure. You can then provide your contact information to healthcare professionals and receive further instructions.\n\nIf you think that you may have COVID-19, you can take a symptom assessment at any time in the Omaolo.fi web service.
The app protects your privacy in the following ways:
The information on encounters is stored only on your device. The stored data is deleted within 21 days, and it is deleted immediately if you remove the app.
Your identity is encrypted using random IDs.
The app never saves your phone\'s location information.
Do you need to disable exposure notifications?

In some situations, it may be necessary to temporarily disable exposure notifications. This may be the case, for example, if you are a healthcare professional and do not want to use the application at your workplace.\n\nIf you disable exposure notifications, the application will stop working.
To protect your health and the health of your loved ones, it is recommended that you disable exposure notifications only if it is really necessary. Remember to enable them again as soon as possible.
Are you sure you want to disable exposure notifications?
If you disable exposure notifications, Koronavilkku will not be able to notify you of potential exposure to the coronavirus.
Because exposure notifications are disabled, Koronavilkku is not currently monitoring nearby phones.
To protect your health and the health of your loved ones, it is recommended that you enable exposure notifications as soon as possible.
Exposure notifications could not be turned on
You must allow Huawei\'s HMS Core services to use the location of your phone in order to enable exposure notifications. You can allow this in your phone\'s settings.
You must update Huawei\'s HMS Core via App Gallery in order to enable exposure notifications.
Unfortunately Google Play Services exposure notifications are not available for your device.\n\n%s

You are not logged into your phone as the device owner. Koronavilkku only works with the device owner\'s user profile.\n\nYou can switch between profiles by swiping down from the top of the home screen with two fingers and tapping the Switch User button.
Error: Your device is not supported.
Error: The app is not allowed to turn on exposure notifications.
An unexpected exception occurred, error code: %1$d (%2$d)
Koronavilkku is an application produced by the Finnish Institute for Health and Welfare. It aims to prevent the spread of COVID-19 disease. Your privacy is strongly protected in the application.

Koronavilkku looks for nearby phones that have the same app installed. If someone you have previously met reports via Koronavilkku that they have COVID-19 disease, you receive an exposure notification. If you are diagnosed with COVID-19 disease, you can report this anonymously using the app.
Koronavilkku protects your data and privacy in several ways.

Koronavilkku does not store your name, date of birth or contact information. It cannot determine your identity or the identity of the people you come close to.\n\nThe application does not collect location data.
How the app uses your data

The app informs the server that the app is running. If you contact healthcare services through the app, the app will also provide information that you may have been exposed to COVID-19.

All communication between Koronavilkku and the server is encrypted.

The data is stored anonymously on a server located in Finland, and this server is managed by public administration bodies. The information system is only in use for the period specified in the Communicable Diseases Act. The information system and its data will be deleted when the system is no longer needed.
You do not have to use Koronavilkku. You can stop using it at any time by removing the app from your phone.
I have read and agree to the terms of use for the service.
I am voluntarily starting to use the application
Koronavilkku will not work unless you turn on the exposure notifications in your phone’s operating system. Start by pressing the Enable button below.
On some Android phones, exposure notifications also require that the location setting is turned on. The app does not, however, use your location data.
Contact healthcare via the Omaolo symptom assessment

Complete a symptom assessment in the Omaolo service; after this, you will be given instructions and an evaluation of whether you need a coronavirus test. Complete a symptom assessment even if you do not have any symptoms suitable for the coronavirus disease. Filling in the symptom checker takes approximately 5–10 minutes.
If you are under 15 years old, ask your guardian to use Omaolo on your behalf.
Alternatively, you can contact the municipal healthcare services in another way:
Only for people without symptoms (not for children under 15)
Contact healthcare services even if you do not have any symptoms consistent with COVID-19. Healthcare services will give you instructions and evaluate your need for a coronavirus test.
First contact healthcare services by phone or online

Contact healthcare services by phone or online before going to a healthcare facility.\n\nIf your condition is very poor, contact an emergency clinic. If your life is in danger, call the emergency number 112.

You can take the symptom assessment in the following languages. Select a language. You will then be taken to the Omaolo.fi web service. It takes approximately 5–10 minutes to take a symptom assessment.
If you don\'t have symptoms, you can send a contact request via the Omaolo.fi web service. Select the language for the service. You will then be taken to the Omaolo.fi web service.
Koronavilkku can\'t direct you to the Omaolo.fi web service because your phone does not have an internet browser or its use has been blocked. Please contact health services by telephone.
Error loading municipality list. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Web page cannot be opened because your phone does not have an internet browser or its use has been blocked.
Let Koronavilkku always run in the background?

Koronavilkku can check if you have been exposed to COVID-19 even while the app is closed. This requires disabling battery life optimisation for Koronavilkku.\n\nThe impact on your phone\'s battery life is minimal.
If you don\'t allow Koronavilkku to always run in the background, we recommend opening Koronavilkku manually at least once a day.\n\nYou can change this setting at any time in your phone\'s Settings.
Exposure data could not be loaded. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Users of Koronavilkku and other European COVID-19 applications.
Who do you want to report your infection to?
Koronavilkku got your key code from a text message.
Have you travelled abroad within the past 14 days?
Which countries have you visited within the past 14 days? If the country you visited is not listed or you do not want to disclose it, select Other.
Information about your infection will be shared anonymously with users of Koronavilkku and other European COVID-19 applications.
Information about your infection will be shared anonymously with users of Koronavilkku.
You have visited these countries within the past 14 days:
You have not travelled abroad within the past 14 days.

My encounter data and the estimated period of when I could have infected others may be shared with Koronavilkku for the purpose of breaking transmission chains.\n\nI give this consent voluntarily. My consent has not been required in a healthcare customer service situation nor in a procedure of authority.

My encounter data, the travel information I have selected above, and the estimated period of when I could have infected others may be shared to COVID-19 applications used in the EU, EEA, Switzerland and the United Kingdom for the purpose of breaking transmission chains.
Once you have sent the information, you cannot withdraw your consent.
If you receive an exposure notification follow these instructions

If you have been near a person who has reported their coronavirus infection via the application, you will receive a notification of potential exposure to your phone. Tap on the notification to open Koronavilkku.
Press the red See instructions button.
You will receive instructions on what to do. You will also receive instructions on how to contact a healthcare provider. Read the instructions and press the Contact button.
Select the municipality. You can contact the healthcare services via the contact methods provided by the municipality, such as via the Omaolo online service or by telephone.
The healthcare services will give you more detailed instructions and evaluate your need for a coronavirus test.
